info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued November 28 at 8:49AM MST until November 28 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ..RED FLAG WARNING THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE NORTHEAST PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WIND AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Two to 4 hours of critical fire weather conditions are expected this afternoon across the northeast plains. Strengthening flow aloft and a sharp surface trough in the lee of the Sangre de Cristo Mountains will result in strong southwest winds. Humidities will also drop below 15% for most of the afternoon as high temperatures reach around 5 to 10 degrees above normal with a Haines Index of 5 and a Red Flag Threat Index peaking in the 4 to 6 range south of Union County. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon today to 5 PM MST this afternoon. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains all afternoon. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...10 to 13 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
